title.narrative: Niger (le): Aide ciblée aux pays
Niger (the): Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

NERICC has a DQIP which is being implemented but not closely monitored and so there is plan to incorportate the indicators onto NERICC dashboard. 3. The 2 WHO officers in Data Team supports NERICC to conduct monthly analysis of RI data from DHIS2 and SMS and also preparation of PAPA/LQAS preliminary finding/report from the analysis (WHO is the leading agency on PAPA/LQAS).

title.narrative: WHO : Vaccine-Specific Support
1. Operational manuals for IPV2, Rota, COVID-19 developed. 2. Concept note for COVID-19 Impact Assemment.

target.value: 1. Development of training and operational manuals for new vaccine introduction (IPV2, Rota, HPV). 2. Develop a protocol for the conduct COVID-19 vaccine introduction impact assessment. 3.Develop regular feedback on updates of VPD surveillance 4. Develop an integrated strategies for using SIAs to improve Routine Immunisation 5. Monitor impact of vaccines introduced and scaled up (measles, yellow fever, meningitis etc)

comment.narrative: 1. Supported the development of IPV2 training manual which will soon be printed for training in July. Rota and HPV manuals are yet to be developed because the country had not received Gavi approval yet. 2. COVID-19 vaccine introduction is current ongoing and so it impact assessment is yet to be conducted, however the development of the impact assessment protocol will soon commenced. 3. A section on how to improve routine immunization using SIA has been incorporated into the SIA Guideline. 4. PIE for MCV2 and MenA introduction is yet to be carried out due to COVID-19 outbreaks and COVID-19 vaccine rollout. There is plan to have the evaluation before the year runs out.

title.narrative: 1. Guidelines for integrating RI in SIA interventions developed 2. Protocol for COVID-19 impact assessment finalised

target.value: 1. Development of training and operational manuals for new vaccine introduction (IPV2, Rota, HPV). 2. Develop a protocol for the conduct COVID-19 vaccine introduction impact assessment. 3.Develop regular feedback on updates of VPD surveillance 4. Develop an integrated strategies for using SIAs to improve Routine Immunisation 5. Monitor impact of vaccines introduced and scaled up (measles, yellow fever, meningitis etc)

comment.narrative: 1. Training manual for IPV2 introduction developed and used for training of health workers. Training materials for Rota and HPV are yet to be developed as Gavi has not given approval for introduction yet. 2. Month VPD Surveillance shared with government and partners. 3. Supported Polio EOC to develop protocol for routine immunization intensification during OBR and integration of RI and NPSIA activities such as yellow fever & Men. A. Yet to develop protocol for COVID-19 vaccination Impact. This has been rolled over to 2022.

title.narrative: CDC : Service Delivery

1) YF lab training scheduled 2) All states transitioned to SORMAS; post transition evaluations completed 3) National surveillance and OB investigation and response training for measles and YF completed 4) Draft guidelines and SOPs for measles RDT implementation completed

target.value: To reduce the number of outbreaks in the country, it is critical that surveillance and lab testing capacity is optimal. The US CDC will continue to support NCDC in the development of a national disease surveillance system, lab network, outbreak response plans, and diagnostic testing for measles, rubella and yellow fever to include: 1) Conduct lab training for the testing of measles, rubella, and yellow fever 2) Finalize surveillance and outbreak response guidance 3) Develop curriculum and support national and subnational surveillance and outbreak response training for measles and yellow fever, 4) Support implementation of SORMAS surveillance system 5) Support outbreak investigations with NCDC staff by training state and local level staff 6) Introduce measles rapid diagnostic testing

comment.narrative: Activities are either completed or delayed due to travel restrictions related to COVID19 and will be implemented once the restrictions are lifted. (1) The lab training for the testing of MRYF will be conducted next year, 2022. (2) Surveillance and outbreak response guidance is developed (3) Curriculum development is ongoing. (4) The system for the SORMAS surveillance is ongoing, a few more states are yet to implement (5) The outbreak investigation materials have been developed andimplementation will be done in line with government plans. (6) Measles rapid diagnostic testing not yet introduced as we await supplies.

title.narrative: 1) Finalize and distribute surveillance and outbreak response guidance 2) Develop curriculum and support national and subnational surveillance and outbreak response training for measles and yellow fever 3) Support VPD data transition to SORMASacross all states, with at least one quarterly review completed 4) Draft SOPs for measles and YF outbreak investigation and response

target.value: To reduce the number of outbreaks in the country, it is critical that surveillance and lab testing capacity is optimal. The US CDC will continue to support NCDC in the development of a national disease surveillance system, lab network, outbreak response plans, and diagnostic testing for measles, rubella and yellow fever to include: 1) Conduct lab training for the testing of measles, rubella, and yellow fever 2) Finalize surveillance and outbreak response guidance 3) Develop curriculum and support national and subnational surveillance and outbreak response training for measles and yellow fever, 4) Support implementation of SORMAS surveillance system 5) Support outbreak investigations with NCDC staff by training state and local level staff 6) Introduce measles rapid diagnostic testing

comment.narrative: "1) Surveillance and OBR guidance are pending final review/approval by the Director General of the Nigeria Centres for Disease Control; will be distributed once received. 2) Development of curiculum and training for MR and YF surveillance and outbreak response is delayed, pending final approval of the guidance, and will be developed/conducted as soon as possible once the guidance is approved. 3) Training for SORMAS VPD data transmission has been completed, following a minor delay. Temporary staff selected to support the transition are in place: one at each LGA (774) and two at each of teh six regional labs (12). Transition activities are ongoing and on track. The first quarterly review is not yet due, but is on track to be conducted. 4) SOPs for MR and YF investigation and response are in early draft form, following minor Covid-related delays. Work on this activity is ongoing."

comment.narrative: Les registres communautaires intégrant les activités de vaccination, de nutrition, d'enregistrement des naissances et de prise en charge de la diarrhée ont été validés avec la participation des toutes les parties prenantes (Direction des Immunisations, Direction de la Santé Communautaire, Direction des Statistiques, de l' Etat Civil, de la Nutrition). les registres communautaires sont en cours de reproduction. 82 formateurs du Ministres de la santé, des régions et des districts ont été formés sur le registre communautaire. Par ailleurs le module registre communautaire a été intégré dans le paquet complet du relais par la Direction de la Santé Communautaire. Une formation des relais a été organisée dans les districts sanitaires pilotes de Malbaza et de Niamey 4. Aussi, une digitalisation à travers le Kobo collect est en cours à Niamey 4.

title.narrative: CDC Foundation

Consistent weekly reporting of meningitis cases and testing of CSF obtained from participating districts; and generation of weekly meningitis surveillance bulletins/reports for MOH and key partners to monitor trends in meningitis disease and early detection of epidemics.

target.value: In collaboration with Niger under a One TA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to leverage and stregthen case-based surveillance for VPD program monitoring, early detection of meningitis epidemics and equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) provide technical support and trainings to strengthen the detection of bacterial meningitis pathogens by PCR and culture, and reinforce quality assurance programs to ensure laboratory proficiency for the molecular detection at the national level, and bacterial culture proficiency subnationally; 2) provide epidemiological support and tools to ensure efficient data/specimen collection, management, and country-level analysis to accurately assess the burden of bacterial meningitis in the context of vaccine implementation and integration into broader health information systems (i..e DHIS2) to ensure data triangulation between immunization and disease surveillance; 3) reinforce the country's capacity for epidemic detection and response. Efforts will be harmonized and coordinated with other regional/global activities and partners (i.e. MenAfriNet, WHO ICG Vaccine Stockpile)

comment.narrative: Despite the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, CDC through leadership of MenAfriNet, strengthened case-based surveillance in Niger as a strategic country at high risk for meningitis disease and epidemics. Significant progress has been made to standardize meningococcal case investigation, confirmation, and data management in Niger. Thus far in 2021, surveillance system health was monitored, and technical assistance provided remotely through five monthly MenAfriNet Surveillance and Data Management Working Group teleconferences. During the 2021 epidemic season, Niger shared meningitis surveillance data weekly to inform epidemic situation monitoring and epidemic response. Between January-June, Niger had 5 districts in alert, two epidemics, with meningococcus C as the dominant serogroup. With successful application to WHO ICG for meningococcal vaccine, we completed two reactive campaigns with menC conjugate vaccine (Menactra). Niger expanded case-based surveillance nationally in 2020, but struggled to collect case-based data from new districts. To improve the timeliness of case-based surveillance data, STELab 2.0 multi-disease data management and specimen tracking system completed a successful pilot in 5 districts in December 2020, and will be rolled out nationally in Q3 2021. STELab 2.0 is an integrated multi-disease system with case-based reporting modules for Meningococcal Disease, Pneumococcal disease, Hib, Cholera, SARI, Dengue, measles, rubella, polio, Yellow Fever, and COVID-19. The ongoing COVID-19 response has necessitated prioritization of field activities at the country level. Field validation of case-based meningitis surveillance data had to be postponed until Q3 2021 and will be completed concurrently with STELab rollout; validated data will be analyzed and Summary MenAfriNet Surveillance Reports will be published next quarter. In July 2021, Niger will participate in a regional MenAfriNet data analysis training using the R package in Burkina Faso.

title.narrative: Assessment of materials conducted and tools adapted as needed for in-country needs. Materials included in planning for phased MCV2 introduction.

target.value: Leveraging findings from a targeted EPI program assessment in 3 states planned for January 2019, we will provide technical support for the planned introduction of MCV2 in Nigeria in 2019. This will include operations research to identify and mitigate barriers to uptake of second year of life (2YL) services (e.g. MCV2), and recording/reporting of vaccines doses delivered in 2YL; development and roll-out of training materials for 2YL, with emphasis on use of MCV2 as an opportunity to catch-up children on vaccinations that were missed during the first year of life; communications messaging to increase awareness and demand for MCV2

comment.narrative: The MCV2 introduction is complete with a supported roll out, uptake and supervision. The 2YL OR will now be used to support catch up vaccination uptake, including new vaccine introductions that include catch up activities.

title.narrative: Clinton Health Access Initiative : Vaccine-Specific Support

? Funds released for Q3 & Q4 2021 Vaccines procurement ? All planned immunisation funding sensitization workshops for National Assembly, MOPB and MoF completed. ? target.value: Provide technical assistance for the implementation of the financial commitment as laid out in the transition plan

comment.narrative: For the period June 2021 ? November 2021, the Clinton Health Access Initiative (CHAI), under a GAVI-funded grant provided Technical Assistance (TA) at the National level to the Federal Government of Nigeria to support the implementation of the financial commitments outlined in the country?s financial commitment letter to GAVI. CHAI provided TA to the National Primary Healthcare Development Agency (NPHCDA), Ministry of Health (MoH), Ministry of Finance, Budget, and Planning (MoFBP), and the Budget Office of the Federation (BO) & National Assembly (NASS). During this period, CHAI worked with the NPHCDA, UNICEF and key stakeholders to conduct vaccines forecasting and budgeting for 2022 and determine projected requirements for 2022 - 2024. CHAI also facilitated the submission of vaccines funding requirements into the FGoN?s 2022 ? 2024 Medium Term Expenditure Framework by the MoFBP with expected government investment of about $269m for 2022 vaccines procurement. Additionally, to facilitate the timely release of funds for vaccines CHAI facilitated the following - - The development and approval of a memo from NPHCDA to MoFBP requesting for the release of ?16.08bn ($40Mn) from the Service Wide Vote in the 2021 Budget for Q1/Q2 vaccines to ensure that the country meets its co-financing obligations. - The development and approval of a memo from NPHCDA to MoFBP requesting for the release of ?17.2bn (42Mn) from the Service Wide Vote in the 2021 Budget for Q3/Q4 vaccines to ensure that the country meets its co-financing obligations. - The development of the 2022 ? 2024 Vaccines Financing outlook and Monthly updated Vaccines Financing tracker to aid visibility and tracking of Vaccines Financing at the NPHCDA. The NPHCDA will incorporate components of the Vaccines Financing outlook document into the 2022 Vaccines Financing Plan.

title.narrative: ? Conducted training and mentoring of NPHCDA staff on vaccines and financial forecasting ? 2022 State-specific and national vaccines and devices forecast for 36 states + FCT with other health commodities concluded ? 2021 ? 2024 Vaccines Finance outlook documents developed ? 2022 vaccine procurement schedule submitted and reviewed with MoBP and MoF ? Funds released for Q1 & Q2 2021 vaccines ? First line charge preliminary analysis conducted, developed and disseminated advocacy tools

title.narrative: John Snow, Inc. : Health Information Systems (Data)
Documentation of the final implementation results of the DRS

target.value: Data Review System

comment.narrative: In collaboration with the WHO, JSI contributed to a 4-day workshop from May 6 ? May 10 on data triangulation related to COVID-19 vaccination. JSI co-facilitated the analysis of data through providing TA. The workshop highlighted areas for a more systematic and routine process for data triangulation. Additionally, the MOH used data triangulation to inform the country's decision to send COVID-19 vaccines to Cote d'Ivoire and to readjust the in-country strategy. JSI has transferred capacity to the MoH EPI team so that they are able to continue data triangulation efforts.

title.narrative: ? Supportive supervision visits conducted in one region

comment.narrative: JSI participated in one supportive supervision visit in Maradi and Tahoua regions between September 16 and October 3, 2021, as part of the preparations for ultra-cold chain (UCC) equipment for the Pfizer vaccine.

title.narrative: Data review team meetings conducted monthly

target.value: Support the functionality of data review team at national level

comment.narrative: Official data review meetings are currently being conducted every three months, due to competing priorities related to COVID-19. However, WHO has requested for data review meetings to be on a monthly basis, and the country is shifting to monthly meetings. Additionally, data is reviewed by a smaller team on a regular basis, bi-weekly or monthly. Results of this small team analysis is shared at the quarterly meetings and will be incorporated into the monthly meetings.

title.narrative: CDC Foundation : Health Information Systems (Data)

Consistent weekly reporting of meningitis cases and testing of CSF obtained from participating districts; and generation of weekly meningitis surveillance bulletins/reports for MOH and key partners to monitor trends in meningitis disease and early detection of epidemics.

target.value: In collaboration with Nigeria under a One TA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to leverage and strengthen case-based surveillance for multi-disease VPD program monitoring, early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) provide epidemiological support and tools to ensure efficient data/specimen collection, management, and country-level analysis to accurately assess the burden of bacterial meningitis in the context of vaccine implementation and integration into broader health information systems; 2) integrate with other national disease priorities to ensure data triangulation between immunization and disease surveillance; 3) reinforce the country's capacity for epidemic detection and response. Efforts will be harmonized and coordinated with other regional/global activities and partners (i.e. MenAfriNet, WHO ICG Vaccine Stockpile), 4) technical support for preperation and participation in Annual Meeting of Meningitis Belt Countries

comment.narrative: COVID-19 has impacted public health programs in Nigeria and put direct international technical assistance on hold. However, CDC through leadership of MenAfriNet, continues to provide remote technical assistance through monthly regional and bilateral teleconferences during the 2021 meningitis epidemic season. In 2021, Nigeria participated in MenAfriNet Surveillance & Data Management Work Group meetings, and shared meningitis surveillance data weekly to inform epidemic situation monitoring--between January-June 2021, Nigeria reported 127 cases, one LGA in Alert, but experienced no meningococcal epidemics. An evaluation of the national meningitis surveillance (SORMAS) variables was completed in Q4 2020 in support of WHO/country plans for implementation of a regional DHIS2 meningitis case based surveillance module which is planned for 2021-22. Nigeria attended The Annual Meeting of Meningitis Belt countries hosted virtually by Chad on 8-9 December 2020 and completed their epidemic preparedness plan as a part of side-meetings to the plenary meeting.

target.value: In collaboration with Niger under a One TA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to leverage and strengthen case-based surveillance for multi-disease VPD program monitoring, early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) provide epidemiological support and tools to ensure efficient data/specimen collection, management, and country-level analysis to accurately assess the burden of bacterial meningitis in the context of vaccine implementation and integration into broader health information systems (i..e DHIS2); 2) integrate with other national disease priorities to ensure data triangulation between immunization and disease surveillance; 3) reinforce the country's capacity for epidemic detection and response. Efforts will be harmonized and coordinated with other regional/global activities and partners (i.e. MenAfriNet, WHO ICG Vaccine Stockpile)

comment.narrative: Despite the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, CDC through leadership of MenAfriNet, strengthened case-based surveillance in Niger as a strategic country at high risk for meningitis disease and epidemics. Significant progress has been made to standardize meningococcal case investigation, confirmation, and data management in Niger. Thus far in 2021, surveillance system health was monitored, and technical assistance provided remotely through five monthly MenAfriNet Surveillance and Data Management Working Group teleconferences. During the 2021 epidemic season, Niger shared meningitis surveillance data weekly to inform epidemic situation monitoring and epidemic response. Between January-June, Niger had 5 districts in alert, two epidemics, with meningococcus C as the dominant serogroup. With successful application to WHO ICG for meningococcal vaccine, we completed two reactive campaigns with menC conjugate vaccine (Menactra). Niger expanded case-based surveillance nationally in 2020, but struggled to collect case-based data from new districts. To improve the timeliness of case-based surveillance data, STELab 2.0 multi-disease data management and specimen tracking system completed a successful pilot in 5 districts in December 2020, and will be rolled out nationally in Q3 2021. STELab 2.0 is an integrated multi-disease system with case-based reporting modules for Meningococcal Disease, Pneumococcal disease, Hib, Cholera, SARI, Dengue, measles, rubella, polio, Yellow Fever, and COVID-19. The ongoing COVID-19 response has necessitated prioritization of field activities at the country level, and field validation of case based meningitis surveillance data had to be postponed until Q3 2021 and will be completed concurrently with STELab rollout; validated data will be analyzed and Summary MenAfriNet Surveillance Reports will be published next quarter. In July 2021, Niger will participate in a regional MenAfriNet data analysis training using the R package in Burkina Faso.

target.value: In collaboration with Niger under a One TA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to leverage and strengthen case-based surveillance for multi-disease VPD program monitoring, early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) provide epidemiological support and tools to ensure efficient data/specimen collection, management, and country-level analysis to accurately assess the burden of bacterial meningitis in the context of vaccine implementation and integration into broader health information systems (i..e DHIS2); 2) integrate with other national disease priorities to ensure data triangulation between immunization and disease surveillance; 3) reinforce the country's capacity for epidemic detection and response. Efforts will be harmonized and coordinated with other regional/global activities and partners (i.e. MenAfriNet, WHO ICG Vaccine Stockpile)

title.narrative: Complete training of 2 national and >4 regional labs on detection of bacterial meningitis using the latest effective technology; Implement in-country quality programs to ensure lab proficiency. Complete analysis >90% of specimens collected between Jan-Aug 2020;

target.value: In collaboration with Niger under OneTA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to leverage and strengthen case-based surveillance for VPD surveillance program monitoring and early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) provide technical support and trainings to strengthen the detection of bacterial meningitis pathogens; 2) reinforce quality control programs to ensure laboratory proficiency within the nation wide laboratory system; 3) Improve lab data management, analysis, and reporting practices.

comment.narrative: In-country trainings on meningitis diagnosis using culture, gram stain and cytology, and specimen management were conducted for 17 laboratory technicians from regional and district laboratories. Specimen testing has been completed and supervisory visits will be conducted in Sept-Oct 2021.

title.narrative: Complete training of national and 8 state referal labs on detection of bacterial meningitis using the latest effective technology; Implement in-country quality programs to ensure lab testing proficiency within the lab network; Complete analysis of >90% of specimens collected between Jan-Aug 2020

target.value: In collaboration with Nigeria under OneTA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to strengthen laboratory systems, vaccine preventable diseases surveillance and early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) provide technical support and trainings to strengthen the detection of bacterial meningitis pathogens for meningitis surveillance; 2) reinforce quality control programs and supervision visits to ensure laboratory proficiency within the national lab network; 3) improve lab data management, analysis, and reporting practices.

comment.narrative: Nigeria held a laboratory training workshop with 8 laboratories in high risk states (Gombe, Sokoto, Kebbi, Jigawa, Zamfara, Adamawa, Niger, and Katsina). Training courses included quality management systems, biosafety requirements, specimen handling, culture media preparations, and antimicrobial susceptiblity testing. Pre/post training test scores showed improvement for all participants. Supervisory visits have been planned for 9 states and completed for 6 states (Katsina, Taraba, Kebbi, Benue, Ondo and Rivers). The remaining 3 supervisory visits (Nasarawa, Osun and Abuja) are scheduled to occur in early July 2021 and a final report will be provided. Specimen testing completed. UPDATED REPORT FOR PEF TF 21.1.2 (Unable to update since already submitted): Supervisory visits have been planned for 9 states and completed for 6 states (Katsina, Taraba, Kebbi, Benue, Ondo and Rivers). The remaining 3 supervisory visits (Nasarawa, Osun and Abuja) are scheduled to occur in early July 2021 and a final report will be provided. Specimen testing has been completed.

title.narrative: John Snow, Inc. : Supply Chain & Procurement
JSI participated in Project Management Team meetings

target.value: Actively support all aspects of cold chain management and planning for the CCEOP

comment.narrative: JSI is actively supporting all aspects of cold chain management, as part of the National Logistics Working Group (NLWG) which also serves as the PMT. Some of the cold chain decisions made during NLWG meetings include the selection of Haier HCD110 refrigerators and working with Haier to adjust the design due to an issue with manufacturing.

title.narrative: Plan for cold room mapping and transport monitoring developed

target.value: Support the DI for temperature monitoring during transport and cold room mapping in national/regional levels

comment.narrative: Through another JSI project, M-RITE has procured LogTag devices according to WHO product specifications to expand and implement temperature mapping activities within the walk-in cold rooms (WICRs), as the current devices available in-country are no longer functioning. These devices were received in Niger on October 21, 2021. JSI expects to conduct temperature mapping within walk-in cold rooms in three of the regions of Niger in Q4 2021. The Terms of Reference (TORs) for national-level temperature mapping have been drafted, and JSI will be joined by one person from the Niger Ministry of Public Health (MoH)/Expanded Programme on Immunization (EPI) during this exercise. The temperature mapping exercise will start in Niamey & Tillaberi, then Dosso in December 2021. Transport mapping is on-going through use of the Parsyl device. JSI introduced it to one region (Dosso) to use during transportation as well as in WICR for on-going monitoring. It has been well received by the regional immunization officer, as well as by national level supply chain managers who have access to the real-time data being collected.

title.narrative: 100% des districts identifiés ont mis en ?uvre la stratégie de vaccination en milieu nomade

target.value: Appuyer la DI pour la mise en oeuvre de la strategie nomade dans 3 DS situés dans les régions de Zinder et Dosso (Gouré, Boboye et Takeita)

comment.narrative: Tous les 3 districts ont mis en oeuvres la strategie de vaccination avec l'elaboration de cartographie de population nomade en collaboration de l?equipe cadre du district et personnels des centres de santé intégrés, service de l?Elevage, agents du service du plan, de l?Environnement , les Chefs coutumiers, les Maires des zones concernées Cette cartographie a permis par exemple dans le distrcit de Gouré de dénombrer 11 centres de santé intégrés qui reçoivent les populations nomades dans 77 localités. Les distances qui séparent ces populations nomades aux centres de santé de rattachement varient de 2 à 45 km reparties dans tous les sens. - 578 enfants agés de 0-11 mois ont été estimés parmi les populations nomades, 60 personnes représantant des leadres des populations nomades ont été identifiées avec leurs numéros de contact. Ces leaders serviront des intermédiaires pour informer et regrouper les populations lors de passage du personnel de santé pour la vaccination des enfants cible du PEV; - 7 puits pastoraux où les populations nomades se regroupent ont été recensés, - 5 coulloirs de passage ont été recensés. ce travail a permis la Réalisation de 7307 sessions de vaccination en fixe en 2021 contre 5 201 en 2020 ,1359 en 2021 sorties en avancée contre 1114 en 2020 et 451 en 2021 sorties en stratégie mobile en 2021 contre 334 en 2020.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Financial/General Management
19 districts ont mis en ?uvre les activites de vaccination

target.value: Apporter un appui technique de proximité dans la mise en oeuvre des activites innovantes de vaccination dans les 19 districts sanitaires prioritaires de responsablité de l'UNICEF couverts par les 4 bureaux de zone UNICEF

comment.narrative: 100% des districts identifiés ont mis en ?uvre des activités de vaccination. Les consultants déployés dans les 8 régions couvrant les 19 districts apportent un appui technique continue dans l'organisation des activités de vaccination de routine et de masse. 11 districts sur les 19 hébergent plus de 5% des enfants zéro dose comparativement à 9 districts . Globalement , on note une régression de 20% du nombre d?enfants zéro doses en fin septembre 2021 comparativement à la même période de 2020. 74% des districts sanitaires ont connu une régression du nombre d?enfants zéros doses comparativement à 2020. Cette régression varie de 7% à Malbaza à 100% à Tahoua Commune. On note respectivement une régression de 100% dans la zone désertique 89% dans les zones nomades, 67% dans les zones d?insécurité et péri-urbaines. Aussi, l'UNICEF apporte un financement complémentaire dans la mise en ?uvre des activités des vaccination axées sur l?équité dans les districts de Dakoro, Abalak, N?Gourti, Mainé Soroa.

Ces districts ont réalisé la cartographie des mouvements des nomades selon les périodes de l?année et les évenements socio-culturels. Les activités de microplanification semestrielle pour l'identification et l'adressage de differents goulots sont en cours. Ces activités ont été financées par le Fond Commun RSS3 au 1er trimestre.

title.narrative: 72 districts ont élaboré et mis en oeuvreles activites de vaccination pour ameliorer la couverture vaccinale

target.value: Appuyer la planification, la mise en oeuvre et le suivi des activites de vaccination tant au niveau national qu'au niveau regional et district pour augmenter la couverture vaccinale tant en milieu urbain qu'en milieu rural

comment.narrative: Tous les 72 districts ont mis en ?uvre les activités de vaccination en stratégie fixe, avancée, mobile pour améliorer la couverture vaccinale : La CV administrative du Penta 3 a été maintenue au dessus de 90% en decembre 2020, Le nombre des DS avec plus de 80% d'enfants vaccinés en Penta 3 est passé de 55 en Juin 2020 à 58 en Decembre 2020, avec un taux d'abandon passant de 7 à 6 %, le VAR 2 passant de 66% à 67%. La couverture Td 2+ est passée de 75% en juin 2020 à 88% en decembre 2020

target.value: Appuyer la planification, la mise en oeuvre et le suivi des activites de vaccination tant au niveau national qu'au niveau regional et district pour augmenter la couverture vaccinale tant en milieu urbain qu'en milieu rural

La couverture Td 2+ est passée de 75% en juin 2020 à 88% en decembre 2020

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
Project management team estalished and workplan available. ToR for Cold room and infrastructure procurement completed

target.value: Support the construction and outfitting of Abuja Mega hub project implementation at National Strategic Cold Store

comment.narrative: 1. Project management team established 2. PMT workplan developed 3. ToR for cold room and infrastructure work is being finalized to be completed within June 2021.

title.narrative: Project Operational Deployment Plan (ODP) developed for 6,346 CCEs and 30% installation completed

target.value: Technical support for the deployment of Cold Chain Equipment and implementation of CCEOP project as well as facilitating the inventory management system

comment.narrative: 1. Project operational plan (ODP) developed for 6,346 CCEs and shared with UNICEF SD. 2. As at 18 June, 57% (3,607out of 6,346) unit of CCE have been installed from tranche 2 across all States plus the FCT

title.narrative: 100% of national, zonal an state cold stores and 60% of CCEs at LGA and HF level have functional RTM

target.value: Support the coordination of Remote Temperature Monitoring (RTM) system and facilitate capacity to review and provide regular feedback

comment.narrative: 1. The functionality rate has been increased from almost zero to over 50% during this reporting. However, by end of 2021 new generation RTMS will be received in country and deployment wil be completed within Q1 2022 making 100% functionality. 2. 100% CCEOP CCE comes with RTMDs and all are RTMDs are functional. This makes approx 70% functionality at LGA and HF level stores. 3. HSS reprogramming is being requested to procure 5,000 temperature monitoring devices for LGA and HF lecel.

title.narrative: 50% of target states have updated CCE management documents (e.g. CCE inventory, or Cold Chain Expansion and Rehabilitation Plan, CCE maintenance plan

target.value: Monitor the CCEOP implementation, track performance of maintainance units and facilitate development and implementation of maintainance and rehabilitation plans

comment.narrative: 1. The team updates inventory and replacement plan quarterly for 36 states plus FCT. This has helped to readjust the deployment plan where necessary. 2. 36 out of 37 States has established the state maintence units. One state has incuded the budget line for CCE maintenance in annual plan. Others are yet to be pursued on this.

title.narrative: 100% des régions organisent des reunions d'analyse des données de gestion de vaccins et des ECF

target.value: Appuyer les 8 régions et 72 districts dans la mise en ?uvre du CCEOP, le suivi de la gestion des équipements de la chaine de froid et des vaccins

comment.narrative: 100% (8) régions ont réalisé des analyses mensuelles des données de gestion des vaccins et des équipements de la chaîne du froid avec production des rapports d'analyse de SMT, analyse des temperatures avec le système de surveillance à distance (Beyond).

title.narrative: 50% of states under the zone supported to implement workplan and updated supply chain guidance

target.value: Technical liaisons between the NLWG and SLWGs, within zonal catchment areas, and support alignment and implementation of annualized NLWG work plan at state level

comment.narrative: 12 Zonal Liaison officers from NLWG have been appointed to coordinate with the zones, supply chain

title.narrative: Les ressources humaines dediées à la chaîne d'approvisionnement sont formées dans l'utilisation du tableau de bord de la gestion des vaccins

target.value: Appuyer la Direction des Immunisations dans l'amélioration de la disponibiité, la qualité et l'utilisation des données de gestion de l'information logistique (vaccins et équipements de la chaine du froid)

comment.narrative: 33 personnes (15 cadres de la Direction Nationale des Immunisations, 7 consultants de l'UNICEF, 3 staff UNICEF et les 8 coordonnateurs régionaux des immunisations) sont formées et utilisent le tableau de bord.

title.narrative: 60% installation completed

target.value: Technical support for the deployment of Cold Chain Equipment and implementation of CCEOP project as well as facilitating the inventory management system

comment.narrative: 4,000 out of 6,346 (62%) installation of CCEs completed during reporting period. 1. Supported project management team to successfully implement the project. 2. Pursued high level engagement for the country joint investment. CJI of US$23m yet to be deposited to procure and deply balance 2,300 CCEs.

title.narrative: Les plans de déploiement operationnels du CCEOP 2 et de l'année 5 du CCEOP 1 sont élaborés

target.value: Appuyer la DI et les 8 régions dans la mise en ?uvre du CCEOP, et le suivi de la gestion des équipements de la chaine de froid a tous les niveaux

comment.narrative: 494 équipements du CCEOP ont été réceptionnés sur les 611 attendus avec une forte implication de l'équipe UNICEF dans le dédouanement. Le premier lot est en cours de distribution et d'installation dans les sites identifiés à cet effet. Aussi, l'UNICEF a assuré un suivi rigoureux dans la correction du défaut de fabrication en lien avec une défection de la tuyauterie constaté sur 310 réfrigérateurs HTC-110. Les 117 équipements restants sont attendus d'ici la fin Novembre 2021. L'ODP a été actualisé avec les nouvelles acquisitions ce qui portera la couverture des points de prestations en ECF Homologués de 53% à 75%. 11 consultants logisticiens couvrant les 8 régions dont 8 sous financement TCA Gavi (4 CCEOP, 4 COVID 19) ont contribué dans le suivi mensuel du fonctionnement des ECF avec prise d'action correctrices.

title.narrative: internal workflows for the hubs developed

target.value: Support operationalisation of the 3 Hub project including process mapping, human resource allocation and capacity (people), workflows integration and synergies (systems) leveraging appropriate technologies (eLMIS and its integration with the HMIS and or N SCIP tool) as per GAVI iSC2 mission recommendation

comment.narrative: A committee on system design and 3 hub operationalization was established comprising of NPHCDA and UNICEF. Concept note for the commencement of the analyisis for the operationalisation of the Hub was developed. Letter of request for the commencement of the engagement for the operationalisation and analysis and plans to be sent by NPHCDA

title.narrative: 40% of the action points from the coordination meeting implemented in atleast 50% of the states in the zone

target.value: Support the strenghening of ZLWG/SLWG and facilitate coordination efforts with other relevant fora to achieve supply chain synergy at subnational level

comment.narrative: About 70% of the planned ZLWG meetings were conducted, about 55% of the action points implemented. Frequency of SLWGs meeting has increased by about 10% due to the rollout of COVID-19 vaccine. About 60% of the planned CCO meetings were conducted

title.narrative: Revised target coverage, population and other assumptions developed and 2022 forecasting exercise conducted

target.value: 1. Facilitate conduct of nationwide physical stock count exercise, supporting the entrenchment of quarterly PSC and Conduct of annual state specific vaccines and devices forecasting exercise in line with revised coverage and targets; support conduct of vaccine audit exercise

comment.narrative: Because of the competing priorities, this activity was not conducted and the stock count as reported via ODK from 37 states, 774 LGAs, 6 zonal stores and national store was used for the 2022 forecast. There is need to reprogram the funds for this activity to the operationalisation of 3 hub and other supply chain strengthening activities

title.narrative: eLMIS solution selected and developed. Training for the roll out conducted Sites for field test identified

target.value: Provide technical support in the development of business and technical requirement for development and deployment of eLMIS.

comment.narrative: Country has selected open LMIS starting with COVID-19 Modules. Technical requirement established, training for users finalised and has started piloting it

title.narrative: Training for eLMIS users facilitated in the 100% of the states in the zone

target.value: Facilitate rollout of e-LMIS at subnational levels and support monitoring of accuracy, timeliness and completeness of reporting

comment.narrative: Country has selected open LMIS starting with COVID-19 Modules. Technical requirement established, training for users finalised and has started piloting it.

title.narrative: country's EVM environment set up reviewed, Site selection conducted and assesment created, assessor refresher orientation conducted. 2 system design assesment completed in targetted states

target.value: In line with GAVI Immunization Supply Chain Steering Committee (iSC2) mission recommendation, provide Technical Support for the conduct of quarterly targeted and nationwide EVMAs, Development and monitoring of cIPs, facilitating system design activities, and implementation of iSC2 recommendations

comment.narrative: EVM 2.0 parameters reviewed on the Nigeria's platform. Quarterly cIP updated with 80.70% level of implementation of at national level. Targeted for NSCS created to conducted end of the month. Refresher training on EVMA not conducted due to COVID-19 vaccine roll out. System design assessment completed in 8 states of Niger, Zamfara, Gombe, Kebbi, Katsina, Taraba, Bayelsa and Jigawa (80% of the 10 states targeted) with stakeholders workshops, landscape assessment, baseline scenario and prioritization completed. States of Kano and Lagos are at the stage of landscape scenario and data collection.

title.narrative: Recommendations from the FtV finalised and action plan developed

target.value: Support the implementation of FtV and vaccine audit exercise recommendations to improve vaccine accountability

comment.narrative: Follow the vaccine activity finalized in 12 states. Recommendations are being finalized as part of the overall report. Action plan to be developed following the finalization and dissimilation

target.value: Support the implementation of FtV and vaccine audit exercise recommendations to improve vaccine accountability

comment.narrative: FtV- immunization supply chain audit concluded and recommendations shared. However, action plan to implement the recommendations yet to be developed.

title.narrative: 1.PSC RFQs and vendors selection finalised, PSC data and reports available.2. Mock audit exercise conducted 3.Forecast for 2021 reviewed and adjusted

target.value: 1. Facilitate conduct of nationwide physical stock count exercise, supporting the entrenchment of quarterly PSC and Conduct of annual state specific vaccines and devices forecasting exercise in line with revised coverage and targets; support conduct of vaccine audit exercise

comment.narrative: Insourced physical stock counts was conducted at national, zonal, state level monthly from February to May. Following up with weekly stock data reported via ODK and comparison with physical stock done during the period. The outsourced nationwide one-off physical stock count was not conducted and now planning to reprogram the funding for the activity.

title.narrative: L'étude de faisabilité d'eLMIS est réalisée

target.value: Appuyer la Direction des Immunisations dans l'amélioration de la disponibiité, la qualité et l'utilisation des données de gestion de l'information logistique (vaccins et équipements de la chaine du froid)

comment.narrative: L'étude de faisabilité d'eLMIS est réalisée, une analyse exhaustive des solutions sur le marché a été faite et le choix a été porté sur la nouvelle génération du SMT développée par Supply Division UNICEF. Une demande officielle du pays afin d'être éligible pour la phase pilote a été adressée au bureau pays de l'UNICEF Niger. Cette requête est le préalable à une discussion de faisabilité avec Supply Division pour l'utilisation du nouveau SMT à partir de janvier 2022.

title.narrative: Un inventaire des ECF est mis à jour

target.value: Appuyer les 8 régions et 72 districts dans la mise en ?uvre du CCEOP, le suivi de la gestion des équipements de la chaine de froid et des vaccins

comment.narrative: La mise à jour de l'inventaire des ECF des 8 régions et 72 districts est effectif et un suivi de la maintenance des équipements en panne est réalisé. L'UNICEF a financé la maintenance des équipements des régions de Maradi, Tahoua et Agadez. Aussi, l'analyse mensuelle de la gestion des vaccins avec l'appui des consultants CCEOP est effective.

title.narrative: La revue de la composante logistique et chaine d'approvisionnement a finalisée

target.value: Appuyer la revue externe du PEV pour la composante logistique et chaîne d'approvisionnement des vaccins

comment.narrative: La non atteinte de ce résultat est en lien avec le report de la revue PEV initialement prévue en 2021.

title.narrative: Les TDR du consultant pour la revue externe du PEV composante logistque sont finalisés

target.value: Appuyer la revue externe du PEV pour la composante logistique et chaîne d'approvisionnement des vaccins

comment.narrative: La non atteinte de ce résultat est en lien avec le report de la revue PEV initialement prévue en 2021. Par conséquent , le recrutement n'est pas effectif.

target.value: Appuyer la revue externe du PEV pour la composante logistique et chaîne d'approvisionnement des vaccins

comment.narrative: La revue du PEV est planifiée dans le PAA de la DI mais connait un retard dans les préparatifs en lien avec un chevauchement de l'intensification de la vaccination contre la COVID-19, les ripostes contre l'épidemie de polio de source vaccinale

title.narrative: 72 districts utilisent l'Outil "Stock report" pour la visibilité du niveau des stocks des vaccins

target.value: Appuyer la DI dans la gestion des données de stocks de vaccin et la triangulation avec les données de couvertures vaccinales

comment.narrative: La visibilité des données des stock des districts a été assurée grâce à l'outil Niger Vaccine Stock mis en place et le tableau de bord de la chaine d'approvisionnement. Ceci a permis un suivi à temps réel des stock afin d'assurer la continuité de la vaccination. La disponibilité de ce système a permis des redéploiements entre differentes régions et district. A titre d'exemples, en fin octobre 2021 le BCG a été déployé de Niamey à Dosso et Diffa, la PCV-13 de Tillaberi à Dosso. Les analyses régulières de triangulation des données de vaccination d'avec les stocks de vaccins sont réalisées avec l'appui des consultants.

title.narrative: Human resource requirement and plan for deployment available including roles

target.value: Support operationalisation of the 3 Hub project including process mapping, human resource allocation and capacity (people), workflows integration and synergies (systems) leveraging appropriate technologies (eLMIS and its integration with the HMIS and or N SCIP tool) as per GAVI iSC2 mission recommendation

comment.narrative: Lagos hub construction contract has just been awarded and site yet to be clear. Abuja upgrade is at the level of design review finalization. Procurement process of of Large cold rooms started. As part of the operationalization the human resource requirement, workflows and system design assessment will be conducted in Q3 and 4

target.value: Support operationalisation of the 3 Hub project including process mapping, human resource allocation and capacity (people), workflows integration and synergies (systems) leveraging appropriate technologies (eLMIS and its integration with the HMIS and or N SCIP tool) as per GAVI iSC2 mission recommendation

comment.narrative: The 3 hubs project yet to be completed. The discussion and coordination have started to develop the operationalization plan.

title.narrative: 30% des activités du plan d'amélioration de la GEV ont été mises en ?uvre

target.value: Appuyer la DI dans la mise en ?uvre du plan d'amélioration de la GEV

comment.narrative: Le taux de réalisation du plan d'amélioration est passé de juin à novembre de 35% à 47% des activités mises en ?uvre dans les 6 composantes de la chaîne d'approvisionnement des vaccins. Cette avancée significative est due en partie à la mise en place du comité de suivi des acquisitions et à la réception effective des acquisitions programmées dans le RSS3.

title.narrative: 8 régions tiennent des réunions mensuelles d'analyse des données de gestion des vaccins

target.value: Appuyer la DI dans la gestion des données de stocks de vaccin et la triangulation avec les données de couvertures vaccinales

comment.narrative: Les analyses mensuelles de gestion des données de vaccination triangulées avec la gestion des vaccins (SMT, DVDMT, Registre des stocks) sont réalisées et partagées à tous les niveaux. Ces analyses ont permis de corriger les incohérences identifiées dans les données.

title.narrative: Les mesures de dédouanement des équipements des années 3 et 4 sont mises en place

target.value: Appuyer la DI et les 8 régions dans la mise en ?uvre du CCEOP, et le suivi de la gestion des équipements de la chaine de froid a tous les niveaux

comment.narrative: Les commandes pour les années 3 et 4 sont confirmées pour les livraisons au deuxieme semestre 2021. Un appui a été apporté à la DI pour l'obtention d'une exonération des droits et taxes en douane (N°000225/MF/DGD/DREP du 19 fevrier 2021) afin de garantir le dedouanement des équipements.

title.narrative: Logistics plans and NDVP finalsed and implemented

target.value: Leveraging on the CCEOP and 3 Hubs system/Abuja NSCS upgrade, support the capacity requirement estimation and prioritization for readiness towards introduction of new vaccines such as Rota; including the implementation of logistics plan.

comment.narrative: Logistics plans and NDVP for the introduction of COVID-19 vaccines finalized. Abuja NSCS upgrade designed is being finalized, Cold chain requirement estimation in view of the new vaccines determined. Plans to procure additional cold chain equipment in line with COVAX CCE support is finalized. Procurement of 3 units of 175 CM3 WICR as part of NSCS Abuja upgrade has reached advance stage

title.narrative: 60% of sites generated for Q2 in zone assesed and reports generated

target.value: Faciltate quarterly effective Vaccine Management Assessments for subnational stores (zonal and state); supporting zones and states to develop, implement and monitor cIPs

comment.narrative: Mock EVMA not conducted. However, cIP is being monitored and about 89% of the cIP activities were achieved at national level. Preparation for nationwide EVMA is ongoing and expected to happen in December 2021

title.narrative: NLWG convened 3 times per week and demonstrated to be meeting regularly in past [6] months

target.value: Provide technical support to the development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of NLWG strategic priorities and initiatives as detailed in the annualised work plan; Support the strengthening of NLWG and ZLWGs and facilitate the integration of the broader PHC supply chain coordination efforts.

comment.narrative: National Logistics Working Group was finalized and being implemented. 3 times a week meeting is being conducted with one expanded NLWG incorporating state officers to improve coordination. Action points are being tracked for implementation. Zonal liaison for zonal logistics working groups are appointed from the NLWG. Monthly CCOs meeting are being conducted. 28, 26, 23 states have conducted CCO coordination meeting in July, August and September respectively.

title.narrative: Strategic planning documentation for Q1 nationwide EVMA and cIP,supported and submitted to NLWG

target.value: Faciltate quarterly effective Vaccine Management Assessments for subnational stores (zonal and state); supporting zones and states to develop, implement and monitor cIPs

comment.narrative: Nigeria's EVM 2.0 environment is set up and reviewed regularly. Mock assessment for NSCS created to conducted end of the month. Refresher training on EVMA not conducted due to COVID-19 vaccine roll out. Planning meeting for the conduct of nationwide EVMA conducted, timelines and budget reviewed. Assessment expected to be conducted in August 2021

title.narrative: 100% of the sites targeted for CCEOP have validated Operational Deployment Plan (ODP)

target.value: Monitor the CCEOP implementation, track performance of maintainance units and facilitate development and implementation of maintainance and rehabilitation plans

comment.narrative: Operational deployment plan for all targeted 6,346 sites (100%) were discussed with all the beneficiary states PMT/ SLWG and validated. The installations were randomly inspected during the supportive supervisions and any irregularity were reported.

title.narrative: 20% des activités du plan d'amélioration de la GEV ont été mises en ?uvre

target.value: Appuyer la DI dans la mise en ?uvre du plan d'amélioration de la GEV

comment.narrative: Sur 55 activités programmées : 35% des activités sont réalisées (19) , 29% en cours (16) et 36% non réalisées (20)

title.narrative: EVM Assement completed and submitted to MoH, including supporting analysis of VfM and zero-dose considerations (as applicable)

target.value: In line with GAVI Immunization Supply Chain Steering Committee (iSC2) mission recommendation, provide Technical Support for the conduct of quarterly targeted and nationwide EVMAs, Development and monitoring of cIPs, facilitating system design activities, and implementation of iSC2 recommendations

comment.narrative: System design assessment in 10 states finalised, implementation plans being finalised. Preparation towards nationwide EVMA is being finalised, cIP implementation is 89%.

title.narrative: Immunization supply chain annual workplan and budgets including interventions to reach last mile/ zero dose children in place.

target.value: Provide technical support to the development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of NLWG strategic priorities and initiatives as detailed in the annualised work plan; Support the strengthening of NLWG and ZLWGs and facilitate the integration of the broader PHC supply chain coordination efforts.

comment.narrative: Technical support provided and immunization supply chain costed annual workplan available reflecting the iSC priorities. Support provided for the development of subnational immunization supply chain costed workplans through ZLWG and SLWG as well. NLWG, ZLWGs and SLWGs are meeting regularly in the past six month to operationalize workplans. Areas for zero dose intervention identified, vaccine delivery modalities to the implementing facilities are determined, cold chain availability was mapped in the zero dose affected areas in favor of coverage and equity

NLWG, ZLWGs and SLWGs are meeting regularly in the past six month to operationalize workplans. title.narrative: Action plan for the implementation of vaccine audit exercise available

target.value: Support the implementation of FtV and vaccine audit exercise recommendations to improve vaccine accountability

comment.narrative: The FtV audit concluded. However, final reports being reviewed, preliminary outcomes has been used to inform some adjustment on the documentation of the vaccine distribution and issuance. The action plan for the implementation of audit recommendation has been delayed due to Covid-19 vaccination prioritization.

title.narrative: Contract awarded and 40% project works completed

target.value: Support the construction and outfitting of Abuja Mega hub project implementation at National Strategic Cold Store

comment.narrative: The contract award process is in progress, can be awarded before end of Nov 2021. The Hub infrastructures had to be redesigned which was not considered. RFP process took longer than expected. By Jan 2022, it is expected that major upgrade works will be completed and ready for the installation of 3 x 175 cbm WICRs

title.narrative: iSC roadmap finalized and 2022 annualized NLWG work plan developed and submitted to NPHCDA

target.value: Finalization of 10 year iSC road map following the completion of the iSC policies

comment.narrative: Final draft is ready for NLWG validation. Workshop was planned in Q3 2021. However, because of high priority on Covid-19 vaccinations, it has been deferred in 2022. Dates to be determined.

target.value: Finalization of 10 year iSC road map following the completion of the iSC policies

comment.narrative: The draft road map is being finalized. A lockdown workshop has been planned in September 2021 to finalize the document.

title.narrative: eLMIS requirement collection for the country finalised, funding source available

target.value: Provide technical support in the development of business and technical requirement for development and deployment of eLMIS.

comment.narrative: This activity is behind schedule as the selection of the new LMIS has just been finalized and scoping and requirement gathering just finalized. List of the health facilities is being finalized and plan for the implementation starting with COVID-19 vaccine stocks is being discussed. However, there is continuous support to the weekly stock reporting via the ODK, conduct of weekly stock data report review and monthly physical stock count across the 36 states+ FCT.

target.value: Provide technical support in the development of business and technical requirement for development and deployment of eLMIS.

comment.narrative: This milestone has been achieved. The eLMIS is being rolled out.

title.narrative: 80% of the planned meeting between ZLWG and SLWGs conducted

target.value: Support the strenghening of ZLWG/SLWG and facilitate coordination efforts with other relevant fora to achieve supply chain synergy at subnational level

comment.narrative: Virtual meetings have been held between ZLWG and SLWG. Different percentage of the planned meetings held in 6 Zones. In the Zones where meeting between complete team of ZLWG and SLWG couldn't hold, ZLWG representative members attended the SLWG meetings and provided the feedback. In aggregate 60-80% of planned meetings were held. Action points are tracked and followed up. Each zone conducted minimum of 60-80% of the planned ZLWG meeting with some extended with participation of members of ZLWGs. Conduct of supportive supervision by the zonal supply chain consultants to supervise states and mentor SLWGs

title.narrative: Technical guidance based on the countries experience in the new vaccine (COVID-19) deployment adjusted

target.value: Leveraging on the CCEOP and 3 Hubs system/Abuja NSCS upgrade, support the capacity requirement estimation and prioritization for readiness towards introduction of new vaccines such as Rota; including the implementation of logistics plan.

comment.narrative: "1. The Cold chain storage capacity has been expanded for Pfizer vaccine. 93 units ULTF have been deployed and 23 in process. 2. 31 WICRs are being developed to national, zonal and state level stores to expand the capacity required to Covid-19 vaccines and other RI vaccines - Rota, HPV.. "

title.narrative: CDC Foundation : Data
Complete epidemic preparedness plan and Attend the Annual Meeting of Meningitis Belt countries

target.value: In collaboration with Nigeria under a One TA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to leverage and strengthen case-based surveillance for multi-disease VPD program monitoring and early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) provide epidemiological support and tools to ensure efficient data/specimen collection, management, and country-level analysis to accurately assess the burden of bacterial meningitis in the context of vaccine implementation and integration into broader health information systems; 2) integrate with other national disease priorities to ensure data triangulation between immunization and disease surveillance; 3) reinforce the country's capacity for epidemic detection and response. Efforts will be harmonized and coordinated with other regional/global activities and partners (i.e. MenAfriNet, WHO ICG Vaccine Stockpile), 4) technical support for preparation and participation in Annual Meeting of Meningitis Belt Countries

comment.narrative: An evaluation of the national meningitis surveillance (SORMAS) variables was completed in Q4 2020 in support of WHO/country plans for implementation of a regional DHIS2 meningitis case based surveillance module which was planned for 2021-22. Bilateral meetings were held in September and planned for December 2021 with Nigeria CDC to discuss potential integration of SORMAS case based meningitis data in the regional MenAfriNet Surveillance Bulletin in advance of DHIS2 implementation.

title.narrative: Evaluation of data management system efficiency and integration status

target.value: In collaboration with Nigeria under a One TA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to leverage and strengthen case-based surveillance for multi-disease VPD program monitoring and early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) provide epidemiological support and tools to ensure efficient data/specimen collection, management, and country-level analysis to accurately assess the burden of bacterial meningitis in the context of vaccine implementation and integration into broader health information systems; 2) integrate with other national disease priorities to ensure data triangulation between immunization and disease surveillance; 3) reinforce the country's capacity for epidemic detection and response. Efforts will be harmonized and coordinated with other regional/global activities and partners (i.e. MenAfriNet, WHO ICG Vaccine Stockpile), 4) technical support for preparation and participation in Annual Meeting of Meningitis Belt Countries

comment.narrative: An evaluation of the national meningitis surveillance (SORMAS) variables was completed in Q4 2020 in support of WHO/country plans for implementation of a regional DHIS2 meningitis case-based surveillance module which was planned for 2021-22. Bilateral meetings are planned for July 2021 with Nigeria CDC to discuss potential integration of SORMAS case based meningitis data in the regional MenAfriNet Surveillance Bulletin in advance of DHIS2 implementation.

title.narrative:
Evaluate lab testing flows for meningitis within national laboratory network;
Develop a standardized program to ensure lab quality and proficiency

target.value: In collaboration with Niger under OneTA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to strengthen laboratory systems for vaccine preventable diseases surveillance including epidemic prone meningitis disease, and early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) Continue to support laboratory based surveillance for rapid/timely detection and characterization of bacterial meningitis pathogens at national and regional levels; 2) strengthen nation-wide lab network through reinforcing proper lab testing flows; 3) implement effective measures to improve laboratory quality, proficiency and data quality.

comment.narrative: CDC is working with in-country partners on operational plans to implement activities and establish timelines. A questionnaire is being developed for proposed assessment on specimen management and testing flows. Standardized programs with a focus on laboratory quality measures are being developed to ensure lab quality and proficiency.

title.narrative:
Evaluate specimen management and lab testing flows for meningitis within national laboratory network;
Develop a standardized program to ensure lab quality and proficiency

target.value: In collaboration with Nigeria under OneTA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to strengthen laboratory systems for vaccine preventable diseases surveillance including epidemic prone meningitis disease, and early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) Continue to support laboratory based surveillance for rapid/timely detection and characterization of bacterial meningitis pathogens at national and regional levels; 2) strengthen nation-wide lab network through reinforcing proper specimen management and lab testing flows; 3) implement effective measures to improve laboratory quality, proficiency and data quality. 4) provide technical support for preparation and participation of annual meningitis meetings and other meetings

comment.narrative: CDC is working with in-country partners on operational plans to implement activities and establish timelines. Standardized programs with a focus on laboratory quality measures are being developed to ensure lab quality and proficiency.

title.narrative: Support lab testing at the national lab and at least 1 regional lab that have been trained for the detection and characterization of bacterial meningitis and specimen referral;

target.value: In collaboration with Niger under OneTA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to strengthen laboratory systems for vaccine preventable diseases surveillance including epidemic prone meningitis disease, and early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) Continue to support laboratory based surveillance for rapid/timely detection and characterization of bacterial meningitis pathogens at national and regional levels; 2) strengthen nation-wide lab network through reinforcing proper lab testing flows; 3) implement effective measures to improve laboratory quality, proficiency and data quality.

comment.narrative: Lab trainings on meningitis diagnostics will be completed by the end of November 2021 for the Tillaberi, Dosso, and Diffa regions. A total of 58 participants is expected, 24 at Tillaberi (10 from regional and 14 from district labs), 18 at Dosso (10 from regional and 8 from district labs) and 16 at Diffa (10 from regional and 6 from district labs).

title.narrative: Generation of routine meningitis surveillance performance feedback summaries to guide national monitoring and evaluation, with a target of >90% of participating districts reporting data monthly and >80% of suspected meningitis cases have a specimen collected

target.value: In collaboration with Niger under a One TA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to leverage and strengthen case-based surveillance for multi-disease VPD program monitoring and early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) provide epidemiological support and tools to ensure efficient data/specimen collection, management, and country-level analysis to accurately assess the burden of bacterial meningitis in the context of vaccine implementation and integration into broader health information systems (i..e DHIS2); 2) integrate with other national disease priorities to ensure data triangulation between immunization and disease surveillance; 3) reinforce the country's capacity for epidemic detection and response. Efforts will be harmonized and coordinated with other regional/global activities and partners (i.e. MenAfriNet, WHO ICG Vaccine Stockpile), 4) technical support for preparation and participation in Annual Meeting of Meningitis Belt Countries

comment.narrative: Niger expanded case based surveillance nationally, but struggled to collect case based data from new districts in 2020. An evaluation of data management and specimen transport system completeness and timeliness was completed in Q3 2021. To improve the timeliness of case based surveillance data, STELab 2.0 multi-disease data management and specimen tracking system is in the process of being rolled out nationally in Q4 2021-Q1 2022. STELab 2.0 is an African developed, integrated multi-disease system with case-based reporting modules for Meningococcal Disease, Pneumococcal disease, Hib, Cholera, SARI, Dengue, measles, rubella, polio, Yellow Fever, and COVID-19. Following implementation, STELab will be integrated with DHIS2 for regional data merging.

title.narrative: Evaluation of data management and specimen transport system efficiency and integration status, roll-out of updated data management and specimen tracking system nationwide

target.value: In collaboration with Niger under a One TA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to leverage and strengthen case-based surveillance for multi-disease VPD program monitoring and early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) provide epidemiological support and tools to ensure efficient data/specimen collection, management, and country-level analysis to accurately assess the burden of bacterial meningitis in the context of vaccine implementation and integration into broader health information systems (i..e DHIS2); 2) integrate with other national disease priorities to ensure data triangulation between immunization and disease surveillance; 3) reinforce the country's capacity for epidemic detection and response. Efforts will be harmonized and coordinated with other regional/global activities and partners (i.e. MenAfriNet, WHO ICG Vaccine Stockpile), 4) technical support for preparation and participation in Annual Meeting of Meningitis Belt Countries

comment.narrative: Niger expanded case-based surveillance nationally, but struggled to collect case based data from new districts in 2020. An evaluation of data management and specimen transport system completeness and timeliness will be completed in Q3 2021. To improve the timeliness of case based surveillance data, STELab 2.0 multi-disease data management and specimen tracking system will be rolled out nationally in Q3 2021. STELab 2.0 is an African developed, integrated multi-disease system with case-based reporting modules for Meningococcal Disease, Pneumococcal disease, Hib, Cholera, SARI, Dengue, measles, rubella, polio, Yellow Fever, and COVID-19. Following implementation, STELab will be integrated with DHIS2 for regional data merging.

title.narrative: Support lab testing at national and state labs (8 priority state labs at least) that have been trained for the detection and characterization of bacterial meningitis and specimen referral;

target.value: In collaboration with Nigeria under OneTA plan, CDC/DBD proposes the following activities to strengthen laboratory systems for vaccine preventable diseases surveillance including epidemic prone meningitis disease, and early detection of disease epidemics to guide equitable deployment of emergency meningococcal stockpile vaccines: 1) Continue to support laboratory based surveillance for rapid/timely detection and characterization of bacterial meningitis pathogens at national and regional levels; 2) strengthen nation-wide lab network through reinforcing proper specimen management and lab testing flows; 3) implement effective measures to improve laboratory quality, proficiency and data quality. 4) provide technical support for preparation and participation of annual meningitis meetings and other meetings

comment.narrative: The remaining supervisory visits planned for May-July 2021 to state laboratories who had been trained in March 2020 (Rivers, Taraba, Kebbi, Benue, Ondo, Katsina, Nasarawa, Zamfara, and Osun) were finally completed. Trainings were held in November 2021 on the identification of bacterial meningitis pathogens with 10 states within the meningitis belt (Katsina, Oyo, Ebonyi, Imo, Enugu, Anambra, Kaduna and F.C.T.). Supportive supervisory visits scheduled to be conducted in 9 states (Oyo, Katsina, Imo, Enugu, Anambra, Ebonyi, Kogi, Abuja, and Adamawa) in November-December 2021.

target.value: Apporter un appui technique de proximité pour accompagner 19 ECD des 33 districts prioritaires dans l'élaboration des micro plans PEV sur la base du guide ACD/CEA et dans la mise en ?uvre des paquets d'intervention dans les districts sanitaires prioritaires

comment.narrative: 4 districts sur les 19, soit 21%, ont bénéficié de l'appui technique et financier de l'UNICEF pour l'élaboration des microplans axée sur l?analyse des goulots. L'élaboration des microplans axés sur l'analyse des goulots dans les 15 autres districts restants est en cours et prendra fin en décembre 2021. Pour rappel un conflit de calendrier en lien avec la vaccination contre la COVID-19, l'organisation des ripostes vaccinales contre la polio de souche vaccinale ont perturbé le chronogramme de mise en ?uvre. Les quatre districts sanitaires ont bénéficié d'un financement complémentaire de l'UNICEF pour la mise en ?uvre de leurs microplans.

comment.narrative: Deux ateliers de formation des 68 formateurs de districts sur l'approche ACE/Equité ont eu lieu du 18 au 24 mai 2021 simultanement à Maradi et Tillaberi. La prochaine étape est la tenue des ateliers au niveau des districts (la compilation des informations des districts dans l'outil d'analyse des goulots d'étranglement est en cours avec pour deadline de transmission le 01 Juillet 2021).

comment.narrative: Nigeria is one of the countries with high number of unvaccinated/zero dose children and the government and partners have been working on identifying states and LGAs with high number of unvaccinated children/zero doses. UNICEF analyzed the immunization data at state and LGA level and identified 90 LGAs with high number of zero dose children and supporting those LGAs in improving access and utilization of immunization and other services. UNICEF started the supply in July 2021 and the number of children vaccinated improved from July to September 2021.

target.value: Provide technical support to Lagos State in all LGAs in the NSIPSS implmentation and improving RI coverage, identification of missed communities,urban slums, zero dose children, conducting successful NPSIAs, and introducition of new vaccines

comment.narrative: - Lagos State RIWG operationalized the developed annual work plan on RI and other PHC services. Supported the development of 2022 AOP on RI and PHC Services. 11 LGAs identified as prioritized LGAs for zero dose children & missed communities in Lagos States. Supported 3 rounds of LGAs in 11 prioritized LGAs in August,November and December,2021 1189 HCWs acquired knowledge on development of REW/REC REW micro-plan for zero dose children and missed communities. and 152 HFs from 11 supported LGAs developed REW/REC mico-plan. 341,738 children immunized with penta1 in 2021 as against 321,045 in 2020 of same period. Resulted in 20,693 reduction of zero dose children as compared with 2020. IPV2vaccine was introduced in JulyAugust,2021in Lagos State. 1,574 HCWs acquired knowledge on IPV2 introduction and 1,840 training manuals and other materials/data tools were distributed to the HCWs and HFs. 91,225 children immunized with IPV2 vaccines from August to October,2021.

title.narrative: Data desk review or triangulation analysis performed (coverage, surveillance, operational, others)

target.value: Appuyer l'organisation des reunions mensuelles d'analyse et de triangulation des données de vaccination dans les 33 districts prioritaires; trimestrielle au niveau regional et central y compris la production des bulletins trimestriels avec feedback (plan de resolution de problème)

comment.narrative: Au niveau central, des réunions d'analyses des données sont réalisées y compris celles de la vaccination contre la covid-19 et de la gestion des vaccins. Cela a permsi notamment d'alimenter le contenu des différentes faites avec le MSP et ses partenaires (Gavi, OMS-IST, AFRO, UNICEF WCARO...), les présentations lors des réunions de CCIA et la production de bulletin. Voir celui du S1 2021 en attendant la finalisation du bulletin T3. Pour le niveau opérationnel, l'OMS a positionné dans consultants gestionnaires de données dans les régions afin d'appuyer la culture d'analyse et d'utilisation des données. Ainsi ces équipes, en plus des appuis multiformes apportés aux équipes régionales, identifient les districts qui ont besoin d'appui spéficiques et partent les aider.Cela a contribuer à l'amélioration des données notamment de vaccination (routine et covid-19) et l'identification des centres de santé et localités ayant plus d'enfants 0-doses et insuffisamment vaccinés ayant permis de définir les stratégies pour les atteindre.

Pilot project plan developed

target.value: Support the pilot implementation of RoverInk in one (1) district to facilitate data collection

comment.narrative: RoverInk contract is in place (directly with WHO) and sites for RoverInk pilot have been selected (4 regions, 4 districts, 45 health centers). JSI has supported the identification of sites, together with WHO. JSI will help with training, facilitating, monitoring activities, and introducing RoverInk across the country. Health workers will use this device to transfer information into DHIS to initially demonstrate its use, particularly with stock information for better management. Additionally, there is potential to use RoverInk for cold chain equipment (CCE) and to update inventory as well.
