title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement
50% completion of CCEOP PMT workplans across implementing states (annualized)

target.value: 11. Technical support for the CCEOP deployment and implementation

comment.narrative: 1. All activities related to CCEOP Tranche 1 process have completed including coordination meeting with States and signing of the MOUs, coordination with service provider, clearing of the equipment consignment, LSP's logistics facilities inspections, official launching of the CCEOP project 2. Revalidation of operational deployment plan before deployment. 3. Coordination with states for the site readiness for the deployment and installation of the CCE 4. Quality management: a. Weekly report from service provider and feedback when needed procedure in place. Cross check of the update report from service provider with states b. In-process monitoring: the detail planned physical site visit monitoring couldn't happen because of Covid pandemic. However, the PMT visited the initial installation in FCT and provided detail feedback to the service provider. c. Through Zonal and states stakeholders number of sites inspected using the PII monitoring checklist and shared feedback and discussed the issues with stake holders, especially service provider. d. 100% site installation validation of 1200 ties completed through desk review of the installations documents with pictures of different process of the installations. Through this process, number of installations were requested reinstall the solar panels correctly. 5. Issue/Change management: a. Reviewed number of request from states for change of sites and provided advice to accept or not accept the request b. Reviewed number of issues of storage condition of the CCE in number of states and coordinated proper action from service provider. c. Reviewed number of installation issues, such as solar panel not facing in correct direction, and resolved with service provider to reinstall those panels correctly. 6. Results: as at 18 June, 57% (3,607out of 6,346) unit of CCE have been installed from tranche 2.

title.narrative: Independent Consultants (PEF) : Financial/General Management
1. Update Gavi team on introduction and campaign planning and implementation. 2.Provide written reports on work completed to Gavi Secretariat on a monthly basis.

target.value: 1. Support the implementation of Gavi?s strategy of support to the Government of Nigeria (GoN) for strengthening immunisation and primary health care. 2. Provide technical support to the Federal Government of Nigeria (FGoN) through the National Primary Health Care Development Agency (NPHCDA) and state governments to assess the current needs in the primary health care system including immunisation and develop strategies to increase immunization coverage with special focus on reaching zero-dose children. 3. Participate in strategic meetings of the National Emergency Routine Immunization Coordination Centre (NERICC) and other technical working groups such as the Non-Polio SIA team (NPSIA) in line with the operationalization of the National Strategy for Immunization and PHC System Strategy (NSIPSS) and serve as a liaison to ensure linkage between routine immunisation, vaccine introduction and campaigns. 4. Support the GoN to respond effectively and efficiently to any emerging vaccine preventable disease threat (this may include epi analyses and coordination of activities between GoN, partners and NGOs). 5. Assist NPHCDA with developing proposals for Gavi support and addressing issues raised by the IRC. 6. Monitor the implementation of wastage study findings on behalf of Gavi and represent Gavi at related critical meetings with the National Logistics Working Group (NLWG)

comment.narrative: The 2021 dominant activities were focused on the Covid19 vaccine introduction and rolling-out the first 3phases. Despite conflicting activities on ground, we were able to cover 13 out of the 37 States for the non-polio SIAs. In addition, I contributed on the new NSIPSS 2.0 write-up. Activities are becoming more and more focused on the Gavi 5.0 strategy for reaching Zero-dose children. This has started being applied during the implementataon of the SIAs. The CWG is giving a srtrong support for technical guidance for the country.

title.narrative: All states are disbursing BHCPF funds in line with operational manual

target.value: 2. Provide technical support to the implementation of the BHCPF to improve readiness of states to accept funds for primary health care through trainings, and technical support to states.

comment.narrative: The World Bank team conducted a training workshop and implementation review of the NPHCDA and NHIS implementation gateways of the BHCPF. The workshop was aimed at capacity building and implementation readiness for the expansion of BHCPF coverage at the state level. This activity together with continuing TA support contributed to notable improvements in availability and quality of services especially in Abia, Niger and Osun, the first pilot states. Across the three states, there is now one facility per ward which has been fully accredited by the NHIS and the NPHCDA and are receiving performance grants on the NHIS and NPHCDA gateways of the BHCPF for sustained improvement of primary healthcare services.

title.narrative: WHO : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)

3 reunions de CCIA ordinaires tenues au niveau central et 1 reunion ordinaire tenue au niveau des regions d'Agadez, de Tillabery et de Dosso avec rapport dsponibles et 80% des recommandations mise en ?uvre

target.value: Apporter un appui technique au fonctionnement du CCIA au niveau central et dans les regions d'Agadez, de Tillabéry et de Dosso

comment.narrative: 2 reunions ordinaires de CCIA sur 3 se sont tenues au niveau central (3 Mai et 1er Septembre). La réunion du 3 Mai a abouti sur la nécessité de décaisser les fonds du Gouvernement pour l'achat des vaccins et le paiement du cofinancement, la soumission dans le portail de GAVI de la demande du pays pour la campagne rougeole 2022 et la mobilisation des ressources pour soutenir la vaccination contre la COVID-19. La réunion du 1er Septembre a abouti à la validation de la demande du pays à Gavi pour la subvention de la vaccination contre la COVID-19 (CDS), à la redéfinition des stratégies pour la vaccination contre la COVID-19 et à l'évaluation de la mise en oeuvre du RSS3. Au niveau des regions, les réuinons sont en cours de préparation. Elles sont prévues pour fin Novembre dans les régions de Tillabery et Dosso (Tdrs validés et ressources disponibles), et pour début Décembre dans la région d'Agadez (TDRs en cours d'élaboration). Il est à noter qu'une réunions extraordinaire du CIIA s'est tenue au niveau central, pour la validation du PNDV COVID-19, les préparatifs du démarrage de la vaccination contre la COVID-19 au NIger, et sur l'évaluation du niveau de décaissement de la subvention RSS3.

comment.narrative: Une supervision a été organisée sous le lead de la Direction des Immunisations vers les districts sanitaires des huits régions en fin octobre 2021, avec l'appui du niveau régional et du niveau central. Le rapport de synthèse national est en cours de rédaction et sera partagé d'ici fin novembre 2021. Rappelons qu'également les campagnes de vaccination contre la COVID-19 ont donné l'opportunité au niveau central et régional de suivre l'évolution des indicateurs de perfomance de la vaccination au niveau des districts.

title.narrative: CDC

1) All labs have applied for WHO certification 2) Surveillance system revisions in place with standardized weekly epidemiology reports 3)Laboratroy information management system optimize with routine harmonizations with epi data 4) At least 2 outbreak investigated with reports completed

target.value: Support NCDC in development of national surveillance and lab network for measles, rubella and yellow fever diagnostic testing to include: 1) Conduct lab training for lab staff to build their capacity on the testing for various vaccine preventable diseases to include measles, rubella, and yellow fever 2) 1 year Epidemiologist consultant to develop and refine protocols for surveillance, including case investigation and classification and outbreak response for measles and yellow fever, and laboratory/ epi data harmonization including data cleaning, data management, and summary/presentation of data 3) 1 year information strategy support for laboratory information management system 4) Outbreak investigation for measles, rubella and yellow fever including CDC support to conduct root cause analysis of outbreaks.

comment.narrative: 1) National reference lab and 5 regional labs are WHO Certified. NE regional lab in Gombe lost WHO certification and is not functioning. The country is in the process of assessing needs and feasibility of recertification or if not feasible, selecting and establishing another regional lab in another NE site(s) instead. Once selected and established, CDC will provide TA in support of certification applications. Training will then be planned and conducted for laboratorians at newly or re-established NE lab. 2) Standarardized weekly measles epidmiology reports now being produced, though COVID causes interuptions repeatedly. 3) Laboratory information managment system imporved with tracking of lab surveillance quality though optimizaton has been delayed due to COVID 4) Multiple measles outbreak investigations have been supported by this project with outbreak reports completed.

(1) The lab training for the testing of MRYF will be conducted next year, 2022. (2) Surveillance and outbreak response guidance is developed (3) Curriculum development is ongoing. (4) The system for the SORMAS surveillance is ongoing, a few more states are yet to implement (5) The outbreak investigation materials have been developed andimplementation will be done in line with government plans. (6) Measles rapid diagnostic testing not yet introduced as we await supplies.

comment.narrative: "1.) YF lab training delayed due to Covid. Will be conducted as soon as travel to Nigeria for CDC lab trainers can be resumed/approved and training can be scheduled with NCDC laboratorians 2&3) Terms of epidemiologist and lab consultants have been extended for a second year. 4) SOPs for outbreak investigation for measles, rubella, YF ongoing; major delay in integration with root cause analysis on outbreaks and conduct of training due to Covid (GoN staff reassigned to Covid activities). Development of training material is ongoing with CDC and AFENET. Training will be conducted once CDC trainers can be cleared to travel to Nigeria, and when NCDC and NPHCDA staff are freed from Covid-related duties to participate in training"

comment.narrative: Une microplanification a été faite en Septembre 2021 à travers l'exercice d'identification des enfants zeros doses (ZD) et enfants insuffisement vaccinés (EIV) par districts et par CSI dans les 08 regions. Concernant les 04 regions beneficiant de l'appui de proximité de l'OMS (Agadez, Dosso, Tillabery et Zinder), on a denombré en Fin Août 2021, 6 346 enfants ZD et 23 930 EIV. L'exercice de microplanification fait sur la base de cette analyse de situation a permis la mise en oeuvre des activités pour les rattraper entre Octobre et Decembre 2021. Un autre exercice sera conduit en fin decembre pour dresser la situation des ZD et EIV et permettre la proposition des actions à mener au cours de l'exercice 2022. en attaché exemple de microplan fait dans la region de Tillabéri
